contentrichtext.text: '''Joseph Gledhill''' (November 17, 1837 – March 20, 1906) was a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[astronomer]]. He worked as an assistant at the [[Bermerside Observatory]] in [[Halifax, West Yorkshire]], [[England]]. In 1879 he co-authored the book ''A Handbook of Double Stars'' with [[Edward Crossley]] and Rev. [[James Maurice Wilson]] (who was later Canon of Worcester).
